labels.connecting: Connect to a Kafka cluster from an application
labels.topicOperatorUse: Using the Topic Operator to manage Kafka topics

login-in-page.title: Login
login-in-page.text_content: The {product} console delivers real-time insights for managing and optimizing your Kafka clusters. Connect and monitor your clusters effortlessly.
login-in-page.footer_text: To log in, you need to enter your credentials.
login-in-page.log_into_a_different_cluster: Log in to a different cluster
login-in-page.login_subtitle_credentials: Provide username and password to Log in to {clusterName}
login-in-page.login_subtitle_oauth: Provide Client ID and Client Secret to Log in to {clusterName}

EmptyStateNoMatchFound.no_results_match_the_filter_criteria_cle: No results match the filter criteria. Clear all filters and try again.

homepage.title: Home
homepage.page_subtitle: The {brand} {product} console provides a user interface for managing and monitoring your streaming resources
homepage.recently_viewed_topics_header_popover: When you start looking at specific topics through the {product} console, they'll start showing here.
homepage.last_accessed_topics: The last 5 topics this account has accessed from the {product} console.
homepage.empty_topics_description: When you start looking at specific topics through the {product} console, they'll start showing here.

nodes.title: Nodes
nodes.kpis_offline: Prometheus can't be reached, or is not configured. Information on the page will be incomplete. Please check your configuration.
nodes.replicas_tooltip: The overall count of partition replicas hosted by the broker. Replicas provide fault tolerance and data availability.
nodes.rack_tooltip: Represents the ID of the rack or datacenter in which the broker resides.

running.label: Running
running.popover_text: The broker is registered and accepting client requests.

not_running.label: Not Running
not_running.popover_text: The broker is not active yet.

starting.label: Starting
starting.popover_text: The broker is catching up with the cluster metadata.

recovery.label: Recovery
recovery.popover_text: The broker has synced with the cluster metadata but is not fully active yet.

pending_controlled_shutdown.label: Pending Controlled Shutdown
pending_controlled_shutdown.popover_text: The broker is preparing for a controlled shutdown.

controller_status.quorum_leader_popover_text: The leader of the metadata quorum (also known as the Active Controller). It handles all metadata requests from Kafka brokers.
controller_status.quorum_follower_popover_text: Follower controllers replicate metadata written by the quorum leader (Active Controller) and serve as hot standbys in case of leader failure.
controller_status.quorum_follower_lagged_popover_text: Follower controllers replicate metadata written by the quorum leader (Active Controller). This follower is lagging behind he leader. Quorum followers must stay up-to-date to prevent data loss if the leader fails.

node-config-table.no_results_body: Adjust your selection criteria and try again.

topics.title: Topics
topics.empty_topics_body: To get started, create a topic.
topics.input_field_invalid_message: Valid characters include letters from a to z, numbers from 0 to 9, and hyphens ( - ).
topics.hide_internal_topics_tooltip: By convention internal topics are prefixed with __. These topics are usually created and managed by Kafka.
topics.topic_status_tooltip: Indicates the replication status of the partitions in the Kafka topic.A partition is fully replicated when its replicas (followers) are 'in-sync' with the designated partition leader A partition is under-replicated if partition replicas (followers) are not 'in-sync with their designated partition leader.If the status shows unavailable, some or all partitions are currently unavailable due to underlying issues.

partition_table.leader_tooltip: The ID of the partition leader. For a given partition, a broker is elected as the leader, handling all produce requests. Followers on other brokers replicate the leader's data. A follower is considered in-sync if it catches up with the leader's latest committed message. Under-replication occurs when the replicas for a partition fall below the configured replication factor.
partition_table.preferred_leader_tooltip: Whenever a new topic is created, Kafka runs its leader election algorithm for each partition to assign a leader from the list of replicas. This algorithm aims to create a balanced spread of leadership assignments across the brokers. A "Yes" value indicates that the current leader is the preferred leader. A "No" value may indicate that the leadership assignments in the cluster are not balanced.
partition_table.replicas_tooltip: Each partition has designated replicas, with one being the 'leader' and the rest as 'follower' or 'in-sync' partitions. The leader handles produce requests, and followers replicate the leader's data. Replicas can be either "in-sync" or "Under-replicated" in case any of the replicas are not in-sync

topic-creator.title: Create a Kafka topic
topic-creator.description: Create a new Kafka topic, set its properties.

message-browser.title: Message browser
message-browser.description: View the data being produced to a topic. Browse messages, seek to a specific offset or timestamp by partition.

tooltip.size: The serialized size of the key and value. Calculated from the key/value/headers and does not include any overhead associated with the record in the physical log segment within Kafka.

message-browser.no_data_body: Data will appear shortly after we receive produced messages.
message-browser.no_results_body: Adjust your selection criteria and try again.
message-browser.partitions_hidden: {count, plural, =0 {And one more partition} {And {count} more partitions}}

delete-topic.message: The {topicName} topic will be deleted and removed from this instance. Applications will no longer have access to this topic.
delete-topic.title: Delete topic?

ManagedTopicLabel.label: Managed
ManagedTopicLabel.tooltip: Managed topics are created using the KafkaTopic custom resource and are created and updated in the Kafka cluster by the Strimzi Topic Operator.

AdvancedSearch.query_helper: Enter your search terms to find matches within the selected field. Wildcards and regular expressions are not required or supported.

AppLayout.tech_preview_label: This is a Tech Preview version. You are logged in with read-only access.
AppLayout.tech_preview_tooltip_description: Technology Preview features are not fully supported, may not be functionally complete, and are not suitable for deployment in production. However, these features are provided to the customer as a courtesy and the primary goal is for the feature to gain wider exposure with the goal of full support in the future.

ChartCpuUsage.data_unavailable: Prometheus can't be reached, or is not configured. Please check your configuration.

ChartDiskUsage.data_unavailable: Prometheus can't be reached, or is not configured. Please check your configuration.

ChartIncomingOutgoing.data_unavailable: Topic metrics are not available for this cluster or no topic activity found. Please check your configuration.

ChartMemoryUsage.data_unavailable: Prometheus can't be reached, or is not configured. Please check your configuration.

ClusterChartsCard.virtual_cluster_metrics_unavailable: Metrics unavailable for Virtual Kafka Clusters
ClusterChartsCard.data_unavailable: Cluster metrics are not available for this cluster. Please check your configuration.
ClusterChartsCard.used_disk_space_tooltip: Used and available disk capacity for all brokers over a specified period. Make sure there's enough space for everyday operations.
ClusterChartsCard.cpu_usage_tooltip: CPU utilization for all brokers over a specified period. Sustained high usage may indicate the need for resource optimization. Sustained high usage may indicate the need to review cluster capacity, producer send, or consumer fetch configurations.
ClusterChartsCard.memory_usage_tooltip: Memory utilization for all brokers over a specified period. Efficient memory allocation is essential for optimal performance of Kafka.

topicMetricsCard.topics_bytes_incoming_and_outgoing_toolt: Bytes incoming and outgoing are the total bytes for all topics or total bytes for a selected topic in the Kafka cluster. This metric enables you to assess data transfer in and out of your Kafka cluster. To modify incoming and outgoing bytes, you can adjust topic message size or other topic properties as needed.

ClusterConnectionDetails.description: To connect to a Kafka cluster, add a bootstrap address and the properties to establish a secure connection to the configuration of your client application.
ClusterConnectionDetails.external_servers_bootstraps_description: External listeners provide client access to a Kafka cluster from outside the OpenShift cluster.
ClusterConnectionDetails.internal_Servers_bootstraps_description: Internal listeners provide client access to a Kafka cluster only from within the OpenShift cluster.
ClusterConnectionDetails.when_you_have_established_a_connection: When you have established a connection, you can begin consuming messages from Kafka topics or producing messages to them.

ColumnsModal.title: Manage columns
ColumnsModal.description: Chosen fields will be displayed in the table.

reconciliation.pause_reconciliation_description: Pausing reconciliation stops the operator from making changes to the Kafka cluster temporarily. Use this for safe configuration changes, maintenance, or debugging.
reconciliation.pause_reconciliation_text: While paused, updates to the cluster are ignored until reconciliation is resumed.
reconciliation.resume_cluster_reconciliation_descriptio: Resuming reconciliation re-enables operator management of the Kafka cluster. The operator reverts any changes made to the cluster while reconciliation was paused.
reconciliation.reconciliation_paused_warning: Cluster reconciliation paused. Changes to the Kafka resource will not be applied.

AlertTopicGone.go_back_to_the_list_of_topics: Go back to the list of topics
AlertTopicGone.this_topic_was_deleted_or_you_donapost_h: This topic was deleted, or you don't have the correct permissions to see it.

AlertContinuousMode.title: The screen displays only the most recent 100 messages, with older messages rotating out.

ConsumerGroupsTable.title: Consumer groups
ConsumerGroupsTable.state_tooltip:
Reflects the current operational state of the consumer group.

Possible states include 'Stable,' 'Rebalancing,' or 'Empty.' 'Stable' indicates normal functioning, 'Rebalancing' means ongoing adjustments to the group's members, and 'Empty' suggests no active members.

If in the 'Empty' state, consider adding members to the group.
ConsumerGroupsTable.overall_lag_tooltip:
The cumulative lag across all partitions assigned to the consumer group.

Consumer lag is the difference in the rate of production and consumption of messages.

Specifically, consumer lag for a given consumer in a group indicates the delay between the last message in the partition and the message being currently picked up by that consumer.
ConsumerGroupsTable.members_tooltip: Represents an individual member consumer within the consumer group. Monitor the lag of each member for insights into the health of the consumer group.
ConsumerGroupsTable.consumer_group_must_be_empty_description: To reset consumer group offsets, this consumer group must be empty
ConsumerGroupsTable.reset_offset_description: Consumer group must be empty to reset offsets.
ConsumerGroupsTable.member_shutdown_helper_text: To reset the consumer group offsets, all the active members must be shut down.
ConsumerGroupsTable.shutdown_active_members: Shut down active members before proceeding
ConsumerGroupsTable.learn_to_shutdown_members: Learn how to shut down members
ConsumerGroupsTable.dry_run_execution_alert: Dry Run results are accurate as of the execution time, but they may differ when performing the live reset of offset changes
ConsumerGroupsTable.reseting_consumer_group_offsets_text: Resetting consumer group offsets. This might take a few moments
ConsumerGroupsTable.run_and_show_result: Run and show result in console
ConsumerGroupsTable.copy_dry_run_command: Copy Dry Run command to clipboard
ConsumerGroupsTable.custom_offset_error_message: The custom offset value is out of range. Enter a value between the earliest and latest offsets.
ConsumerGroupsTable.invalid_format_error: Please enter a valid date-time in the format yyyy-MM-dd'T'HH:mm:ss.SSS
ConsumerGroupsTable.time_in_local: Date-time is in local time zone
ConsumerGroupsTable.no_offsets_found_description: The selected timestamp did not match any offsets.

CreateTopic.title: Topic creation wizard
CreateTopic.review_and_finish_tooltip: Topic can now be created. You can continue to configure your topic, or you can skip ahead to the review step.
CreateTopic.topic_name_field_description: The name used to identify your topic. This cannot be changed after creation. Consider grouping related topics by using a common prefix.
CreateTopic.format_invalid_helper_text: Must be letters (Aa-Zz), numbers, underscores ( _ ), periods ( .), or hyphens ( - )
CreateTopic.topic_partition_field_description: A topic is composed of 1 or more partitions, which are each an ordered sequence of messages. Partitions enable scalability by distributing load across brokers and consumers. The number of partitions cannot be decreased after topic creation.
CreateTopic.topic_partition_helper_text: One partition is sufficient for getting started, but production systems often have more.
CreateTopic.topic_replica_field_description: The messages in a partition are physically stored as a replica on a broker. Multiple replicas enable high availability by ensuring copies of the data are available.
CreateTopic.topic_replica_helper_text: Replicas are copies of partitions in a topic. Partition replicas are distributed over multiple brokers in the cluster to ensure topic availability if a broker fails. When a follower replica is in sync with a partition leader, the follower replica can become the new partition leader if needed. (replication.factor)
CreateTopic.name: Name

DistributionChart.partitions_distribution_of_total_tooltip: The percentage distribution of partitions across brokers in the cluster. Consider rebalancing if the distribution is uneven to ensure efficient resource utilization.
DistributionChart.distribution_chart_description: Shows how partitions are spread between leaders and followers
DistributionChart.total_nodes_tooltip: Total number of Kafka nodes across all roles (broker, controller, or combined).
DistributionChart.lead_controller_tooltip: The Lead Controller (also known as the Active Controller) is the primary metadata manager in a KRaft-based Kafka cluster. It maintains a global view of the cluster, processes metadata updates, and distributes them to all other nodes.

EmptyStateNoTopics.to_get_started_create_your_first_topic: To get started, create your first topic

ClusterOverview.description: Key performance indicators and important information regarding the Kafka cluster.

ErrorsAndWarnings.tooltip: Issues encountered in the Kafka cluster. Investigate and address these issues to ensure continued operation of the cluster.

ClusterOverview.fully_replicated_partition_tooltip: All partitions are fully replicated. A partition is fully-replicated when its replicas (followers) are 'in sync' with the designated partition leader. Replicas are 'in sync' if they have fetched records up to the log end offset of the leader partition within an allowable lag time, as determined by replica.lag.time.max.ms.
ClusterOverview.under_replicated_partition_tooltip: Some partitions are not fully replicated. A partition is fully replicated when its replicas (followers) are 'in sync' with the designated partition leader. Replicas are 'in sync' if they have fetched records up to the log end offset of the leader partition within an allowable lag time, as determined by replica.lag.time.max.ms.
ClusterOverview.unavailable_partition_tooltip: Some or all partitions are currently unavailable. This may be due to issues such as broker failures or network problems. Investigate and address the underlying issues to restore normal functionality.

MemberTable.client_id_tooltip: The unique identifier assigned to the client (consumer) within the consumer group. A client ID helps identify and manage individual consumers.
MemberTable.overall_lag_tooltip: The cumulative lag across all partitions assigned to the consumer group. Consumer lag is the difference in the rate of production and consumption of messages.Specifically, consumer lag for a given consumer in a group indicates the delay between the last message in the partition and the message being currently picked up by that consumer.
MemberTable.committed_offset_tooltip: The offset in the Kafka topic marking the last successfully consumed message by the consumer.
MemberTable.end_offset_tooltip: The highest offset in the Kafka topic, representing the latest available message.

Rebalancing.title: Rebalance
Rebalancing.refresh_rebalance_description: Refresh the optimization proposal to the latest cluster metrics
Rebalancing.approve_rebalance_description: This will apply the optimization changes, Are you sure you want to proceed
Rebalancing.stop_rebalance_description: Stopping will halt the current rebalancing process. You can start a new rebalance later. Are you sure you want to proceed?
Rebalancing.learn_more_about_cruisecontrol_enablemen: Learn more about Cruise Control enablement
Rebalancing.no_kafka_cluster_rebalances_found_descri: Configure a KafkaRebalance resource to generate optimization proposals and initiate rebalances for your Kafka cluster.
Rebalancing.optimization_proposal_of_kafka_rebalance: A summary of proposed changes based on defined optimization goals, assessed in a specific order of priority.
Rebalancing.data_to_move_tooltip: Total amount of data (in MB) moved across brokers as part of the optimization.
Rebalancing.excluded_brokers_for_leadership_tooltip: Brokers excluded from becoming leaders for any partition.
Rebalancing.excluded_brokers_for_replica_move_toolti: Brokers excluded from losing existing replicas or receiving new replicas
Rebalancing.intra_broker_data_to_move: Intra Broker Data to Move MB
Rebalancing.intra_broker_data_to_move_tooltip: Total amount of data (in MB) moved within individual brokers. For example, log directory changes.
Rebalancing.monitored_partitions_percentage_tooltip: Percentage of partitions being monitored for optimization. If this percentage is low, it may be necessary to investigate why certain partitions are not being monitored.
Rebalancing.num_intra_broker_replica_movements_toolt: Number of replica movements within the same broker.
Rebalancing.num_leader_movements_tooltip: Number of leadership changes for partitions.
Rebalancing.num_replica_movements_tooltip: Total number of replica movements across brokers.
Rebalancing.on_demand_balancedness_score_after_toolt: Balancedness score of the Kafka cluster after optimization. If all goals are satisfied, the score is 100.
Rebalancing.on_demand_balancedness_Score_before_tool: Balancedness score of the Kafka cluster before optimization.  Scores range from 0 to 100, where lower values indicate greater imbalance.
Rebalancing.recent_windows_tooltip: Number of recent monitoring windows used to assess the Kafka clusterâ€™s performance for this optimization.
Rebalancing.full_mode_description: Moves replicas across all brokers. This is the default mode
Rebalancing.add_brokers_mode_description: Moves replicas to newly added brokers. Brokers must be specified
Rebalancing.remove_brokers_mode_description: Moves replicas off brokers to be removed. Brokers must be specified

ManagedConnectorLabel.label: Managed
ManagedConnectorLabel.tooltip: Connector created using a KafkaMirrorMaker2 custom resource and managed in Kafka Connect by the Strimzi Cluster Operator.

connect_clusters.name: Name
connect_clusters.workers_tooltip: Workers represents the number of replicas in the Kafka Connect cluster. This information is obtained from the Strimzi custom resource that defines the cluster and is not available for Kafka Connect clusters that are not managed by the Strimzi Cluster Operator.

KroxyliciousCluster.label: Virtual
KroxyliciousCluster.tooltip: A virtual cluster is a logical Kafka endpoint that clients connect to. The proxy forwards requests to a physical Kafka cluster through its filters.
